title: How to Customize a PDF's Default View in Acrobat Pro

steps.title: Open Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Open Adobe Acrobat. You can also open any PDF document as long as your default PDF program is Adobe Acrobat. [1] X Research source If needed, you can install Adobe Acrobat.

steps.title: Click Edit on the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click Edit on the top toolbar. This will open a drop-down menu. You can also use the toolbar to activate the dark theme .

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . You can find this on the bottom of the drop-down menu, underneath Manage Tools . A new window will open.

steps.title: Navigate to the Page Display tab.
steps.content: Navigate to the Page Display tab. Page Display will be in the left toolbar, underneath Categories . This page may be open by default.

steps.title: Customize the "Default Layout and Zoom".
steps.content: Customize the "Default Layout and Zoom". You can change the Page Layout and Zoom . [2] X Research source To customize the Page Layout , click the drop-down menu and select between Automatic , Single Page , Single Page Continuous , Two-Up , or Two-Up Continuous . To customize the Zoom , click the drop-down menu and select a percentage from 0% to 6400%. Alternatively, double-click the percentage and manually input the Zoom percentage you'd like.

steps.title: Continue to customize.
steps.content: Continue to customize. This is optional. You can customize Resolution , Rendering , Page Content and Information , and Reference XObjects View Mode . You can also rotate pages in a PDF.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save your settings. When you use Acrobat Reader to open PDFs, your default preferences will be in effect. Adobe Acrobat can be used to edit text in PDFs .

steps.title: Right-click the thumbnail of a PDF file.
steps.content: Right-click the thumbnail of a PDF file. This can be any PDF file you have. [3] X Research source A new menu will open.

steps.title: Click Properties.
steps.content: Click Properties . This will be located at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Change.
steps.content: Click Change . You will see Opens with: with the default program. In most cases, the default will be Microsoft Edge. You must be using an administrator account to change these settings.

steps.title: Select Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Acrobat Reader.
steps.content: Select Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Acrobat Reader . This depends on your applications. If you have both Acrobat and Acrobat Reader, select Adobe Acrobat . If you only have Acrobat Reader, select Adobe Acrobat Reader .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . You will be returned to the Properties window.

steps.title: Click OK on the "Properties" window.
steps.content: Click OK on the "Properties" window. PDF files will now open in Acrobat Reader or Acrobat.

steps.title: Open "Finder" and locate a PDF file.
steps.content: Open "Finder" and locate a PDF file. This can be any PDF file you have.

steps.title: Control-click the PDF file.
steps.content: Control-click the PDF file. This will open a menu.

steps.title: Click Get Info.
steps.content: Click Get Info . A new window will open with more information.

steps.title: Click Open with: to expand the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click Open with: to expand the drop-down menu. You will see a list of all supported applications.

steps.title: Select Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Acrobat Reader.
steps.content: Select Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Acrobat Reader . This depends on your applications. If you have both Acrobat and Acrobat Reader, select Adobe Acrobat . If you only have Acrobat Reader, select Adobe Acrobat Reader .

steps.title: Click Change All….
steps.content: Click Change All… . You can find this below the Open with… drop-down menu, but above Preview: . A dialogue box will appear.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . This will confirm that you want to open PDF documents using Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Acrobat Reader.
